results.title: Erosion of our land
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Erosion
results.creator_credit: Soil Conservation Service and United States. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film relates the story of man-made erosion, showing what it has done to the earth’s productive lands. Sheet and gully erosion by water and sheet erosion by wind and their destructive effects are graphically illustrated. Conservation farming methods can overcome both man-made and natural erosion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Soil Conservation Service and United States. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Ernani: opera in four acts
results.creator_credit: Preben Montell, Luca Ronconi, Radiotelevisione Italiana and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: Giuseppe Verdi’s opera in four acts with libretto by Francesco Maria Piave produced for television and performed at Teatro Alla Scala, Milan in 1982. “Ernani” (based on Victor Hugo’s play Hernani) is Verdi’s fifth opera and perhaps one of his most successful pieces of work. First presented on March 9, 1844, Verdi’s “Ernani” went on to become his most performed work for the next fifteen years. It is a passionate story of unrequited love, rivalry, honour, ambition, and revenge leading ultimately to a tragic conclusion. Set in 16th century Spain and Aachen the stage sets for the first three acts are sombre and atmospheric in hues of blues, greys and silver contrasted by the fourth act of warm colours of sunset, gold and bronze. This is quite a spectacular production featuring four world leading Verdi singers in the major roles - Placido Domingo as the bandit Ernani, Mirella Freni as the heroine Donna Elvira, Renato Bruson as the scheming and very suave Don Carlo, King Charles of Spain and Nicolai Ghiaurov as the proud older Don Ruy Gomez de Silva, Donna Elvira’s intended betrothed. The four singers are superb in the way their voices compliment each other and they are supported by an equally class performance from the Orchestra and Chorus of La Scala, with Romano Gandolfi as Chorus Master and Riccardo Muti as Conductor. Sung in Italian with no subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Preben Montell, Luca Ronconi, Radiotelevisione Italiana and National Video Corporation

results.title: Erin Brockovich [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito, Jersey Films and Columbia Picture
results.brief_description: Erin Brockovich (Julia Roberts) is a single mother raising three young children. Failing to win a law suit following an automobile accident, she begins work as a secretary for lawyer Ed Masry where she stumbles over a small case against Pacific Gas and Electric. Further investigation reveals the company is responsible for contaminating the town’s water supply and contributing to the illnesses of a number of families. With Ed’s help, Erin files a law suit on behalf of the families involved. Based on a true story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Soderbergh, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito, Jersey Films and Columbia Picture

results.title: Erikson on Erikson: on developmental stages
results.creator_credit: Thomas Sand and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: Conversation between Erikson and a group of students at the Erikson Institute, edited from 5 hours of tapes. Deals mostly with the eight stages of human development: everyone’s successive steps of development from birth through adulthood and old age, each one leading to certain gains, and laden with its own specific conflicts.
